Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0148J The request to retrieve SSH keys has been processed.

li.p:
Explanation: The SSH key has changed in the endpoint.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Perform an update SSH key operation to restore the connection.

p.b: FQXHMSE0149I The request to retrieve SSH keys has been processed.

li.p:
Explanation: The SSH key has not changed in the endpoint.
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0150I The request to retrieve SSH keys was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: A server error occurred while trying to compare the SSH keys.
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0151J The request to generate the server certificate was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The date must be in the format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying a date with valid format.

p.b: FQXHMSE0152J The request to generate the server certificate was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The date must be in the format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying a date with valid format.

p.b: FQXHMSE0153J The request to generate the server certificate was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The specified not valid before date must be before the current date and time, and the specified not valid after date must be after the current date and time.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying a not valid before date before the current date and time and a not valid after date after the current date and time.

p.b: FQXHMSE0154J The request to resolve the untrusted certificates was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The operation to resolve the untrusted certificates could not be completed because an error occurred when attempting to contact the selected endpoint and retrieve its certificates.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Ensure that the network connection with the endpoint and any associated user credentials are valid and attempt the operation again. If the problem persists, connect directly to the endpoint's management interface and confirm that the certificate that is in use contains the IP address of the endpoint, is not expired, and is signed by a certificate that is trusted by the management server.

p.b: FQXHMSE0500J The provided cryptographic mode value is not valid.

Explanation: The provided cryptographic mode value does not match one of the expected string values. The requested operation was not performed.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying a valid value.

p.b: FQXHMSE0501J The provided minimum SSL/TLS protocol level is not valid.

li.p:
Explanation: The provided minimum SSL/TLS protocol level does not match one of the expected string values. The requested operation was not performed.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying a valid value.

p.b: FQXHMSE0502J The cryptographic mode is not compatible with the minimum SSL/TLS protocol level.

li.p:
Explanation: NIST SP 800-131A compliance requires a minimum SSL/TLS protocol of TLS 1.2. Any SSL/TLS protocol level that is lower than TLS 1.2 is not allowed when the cryptographic mode is set to NIST SP 800-131A. The requested operation was not performed.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Choose a minimum cipher suite level that is compatible with cryptography mode NIST SP 800-131A, or change the cryptography mode, and then attempt the operation again.

p.b: FQXHMSE0503I The minimum TLS protocol level settings for [arg1] were changed to client=[arg2], server=[arg3], OS deploy=[arg4] by user ID [arg5] at IP address [arg6].

li.p:
Explanation: The specified user changed the minimum SSL/TLS protocol level to the specified value.
Arguments
[arg1] Target or targets of settings change

[arg3] Value of new server minimum TLS level setting
[arg4] Value of new OS deploy server minimum TLS level setting
[arg5] User ID of user who changed the setting
[arg6] IP address of user who changed the setting
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0504I The cryptographic mode for [arg1] was changed to [arg2] by user ID [arg3] at IP address [arg4].

li.p:
Explanation: The specified user changed the cryptographic mode setting to the specified value.
Arguments

Severity Informational
Serviceable No

User Response

p.b: FQXHMSE0505J The provided cryptographic mode value cannot be enforced with the current server certificate.

li.p:
Explanation: NIST SP 800-131A compliance requires a server certificate with a longer key length or signed with stronger cryptographic algorithms.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Regenerate the server certificate or sign the certificate signing request (CSR) with encryption and hashing algorithms that meet the NIST SP 800-131A standards.

p.b: FQXHMSE0506J The provided cryptographic mode value cannot be enforced with the currently configured endpoint user accounts.

li.p:
Explanation: NIST SP 800-131A compliance prohibits the use of MD5 authentication and DES encryption for SNMPv3 user accounts.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Reconfigure endpoint user accounts to use SHA authentication and AES encryption for SNMPv3 management.

p.b: FQXHMSE0507J The provided cryptographic mode value cannot be enforced with the current trusted certificates.

li.p:
Explanation: NIST SP 800-131A compliance requires certificates in the trust store (such as those that are used for external authentication servers) to have longer key lengths and stronger cryptographic signature algorithms.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Verify that any externally-signed trusted certificates contain encryption and hashing algorithms that meet the NIST SP 800-131A standards, and then attempt the operation again.

p.b: FQXHMSE0508J An internal connection failure occurred while attempting to change cryptographic settings on the endpoint.

li.p:
Explanation: An internal communication problem with the management server interrupted the request to change the cryptographic settings on the endpoint.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Open the endpoint's management web interface, navigate to the Cryptographic settings tab in the Security section, and manually change the NIST SP 800-131A cryptographic mode and SSL/TLS protocol level to match the settings in this management server. If the failure persists, collect service data and contact Support.

p.b: FQXHMSE0509J The command to change the cryptographic settings on the endpoint failed.

li.p:
Explanation: An error status code was returned while running the command to change cryptographic settings on the endpoint.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt to address any hardware or firmware compatibility issues on the endpoint. Then, open the endpoint's management web interface, navigate to the Cryptographic settings tab in the Security section, and manually change the NIST SP 800-131A cryptographic mode and SSL/TLS protocol level to match the settings in this managementserver. If the failure persists, collect service data and contact Support.

p.b: FQXHMSE0510J The command to change the cryptographic settings failed.

li.p:
Explanation: The input values for whether to apply the settings to the management server or managed devices were both false.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Set one or both of "applyToMgmtServer" or "applyToManagedDevices" to "true" and attempt the request again.

Serviceable No

p.b: FQXHMSE0601I A secure connection to the server at address {0}, port {1} was successful.

Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No

p.b: FQXHMSE0602J An unsecure connection to the server at address {0}, port {1} could not be completed successfully.

Explanation: The server could not be reached because the address and port number are incorrect.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No

p.b: FQXHMSE0603J A secure connection to the server at address {0}, port {1} could not be completed successfully.

li.p:
Explanation: Potential reasons for this issue include: The server could not be reached because the address and port number are not correct. The transport layer security handshake could not be completed because the server is not configured to use transport layer security on port {1}. The server certificate could not be verified because the correct trusted certificates have not been imported. The server certificate appears on a certificate revocation list.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Ensure that the correct trusted certificates have been imported and that the certificates have not be revoked. Then, attempt the operation again, specifying the correct address and port number.

p.b: FQXHMSE0618J Unsecure communication to the server at address {0}, port {1} could not be completed successfully.

li.p:
Explanation: The server could be reached, but a communication protocol error occurred. The server might require transport layer security, or it might not be a supported LDAP server.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Ensure the server does not require transport layer security.
Ensure the server is a supported LDAP server.
Attempt the operation again, specfying the address and port number of an LDAP server that does not require transport layer security.

p.b: FQXHMSE0619J Secure communication to the server at address {0}, port {1} could not be completed successfully.

li.p:
Explanation: A secure connection to the server was established, but a communication protocol error occurred. The server might not be a supported LDAP server.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specfying the address and port number of a supported LDAP server.

p.b: FQXHMSE0620I The LDAP server selection method setting changed to [arg1] by user ID [arg2] at IP address [arg3].

li.p:
Explanation: The LDAP server selection method determines whether LDAP server addresses are preconfigured, or resolved through a DNS service record.
Arguments
[arg1] The new setting
[arg2] The ID of user who changed the setting
[arg3] IP address of user who changed the setting
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0621I A preconfigured LDAP server, [arg1], was added by user ID [arg2] at IP address [arg3].

li.p:
Explanation: Preconfigured server addresses are IP addresses or DNS host names that point to specific LDAP servers.
Arguments
[arg1] The preconfigured server and port number in [address]:[port] format
[arg2] The ID of user who changed the setting
[arg3] IP address of user who changed the setting
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0622I The LDAP root distinguished name setting was changed to [arg1] by user ID [arg2] at IP address [arg3].

li.p:
Explanation: The root distinguished name setting determines the location where LDAP user and group searches begin. A broader root distinguished name, such as dc=example,dc=com, is likely to return more search results than a narrower root distinguished name, such as ou=operations,dc=example,dc=com.
Arguments
[arg1] the new setting
[arg2] The ID of user who changed the setting
[arg3] IP address of user who changed the setting
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0623I The Active Directory forest name setting was changed to "[arg1]" by user ID [arg2] at IP address [arg3].

li.p:
Explanation: The Active Directory forest name is used to locate Active Directory global catalog servers. Global catalog servers contain information about groups that have members in multiple Active Directory domains.
Arguments
[arg1] the new setting (blank is a valid value)
[arg2] The ID of user who changed the setting
[arg3] IP address of user who changed the setting
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0624I The LDAP domain name setting was changed to "[arg1]" by user ID [arg2] at IP address [arg3].

li.p:
Explanation: The domain name is used to locate LDAP servers using a DNS service record. In an Active Directory environment, domain controllers are often located using a DNS service record.
Arguments
[arg1] the new setting (blank is a valid value)
[arg2] The ID of user who changed the setting
[arg3] IP address of user who changed the setting
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0625I The LDAP client distinguished name setting was changed to [arg1] by user ID [arg2] at IP address [arg3].

li.p:
Explanation: The client distinguished name and password are used to authenticate to LDAP servers to search them for user and group information.
Arguments
[arg1] the new setting
[arg2] The ID of user who changed the setting
[arg3] IP address of user who changed the setting
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0626I The LDAP client password setting was changed by user ID [arg1] at IP address [arg2].

li.p:
Explanation: The client distinguished name and password are used to authenticate to LDAP servers to search them for user and group information.
Arguments
[arg1] The ID of user who changed the setting
[arg2] IP address of user who changed the setting
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0627I The LDAP SSL setting was changed to [arg1] by user ID [arg2] at IP address [arg3].

li.p:
Explanation: The SSL setting specifies whether connections to LDAP servers should be secured using the SSL or TLS protocols.
Arguments
[arg1] the new setting
[arg2] The ID of user who changed the setting
[arg3] IP address of user who changed the setting
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0628I The LDAP trusted certificate [arg1] was replaced by user ID [arg2] at IP address [arg3].

li.p:
Explanation: Trusted certificates are used to verify the authenticity of the LDAP server before using it for user authentication.
Arguments
[arg1] the numeric certificate id
[arg2] The ID of user who changed the setting
[arg3] IP address of user who changed the setting
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0629I The LDAP trusted certificate [arg1] was deleted by user ID [arg2] at IP address [arg3].

li.p:
Explanation: Trusted certificates are used to verify the authenticity of the LDAP server before using it for user authentication.
Arguments
[arg1] the numeric certificate id
[arg2] The ID of user who changed the setting
[arg3] IP address of user who changed the setting
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0630I The LDAP user authentication method setting changed to [arg1] by user ID [arg2] at IP address [arg3].

li.p:
Explanation: The LDAP user authentication method determines whether users are authenticated locally or through an external LDAP server.
Arguments
[arg1] The new setting
[arg2] The ID of user who changed the setting
[arg3] IP address of user who changed the setting
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0631I The LDAP user authentication method was set to [arg1] after a change attempted by user ID [arg2] at IP address [arg3] failed.

li.p:
Explanation: Communication with all of the configured LDAP servers was not successful. The LDAP user authentication method was changed to the "Allow logons from local user's" setting.
Arguments
[arg1] The LDAP user authentication method
[arg2] The ID of the user who attempted to change the settings
[arg3] IP address of the user who attempted to change the settings
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Make sure that at least one LDAP server is running
Make sure that there is network connectivity from the management server to at least one LDAP server.
If the management server is configured to use Transport Layer Security, make sure that at least one LDAP server is providing a certificate signed by a certificate on the LXCA "Trusted Certificates" page.
Make sure an entry with the client distinguished name and password configured on the management server exists in the LDAP directory.
After taking the required corrective actions, attempt the change again.

p.b: FQXHMSE0632I The LDAP binding method setting changed to [arg1] by user ID [arg2] at IP address [arg3].

li.p:
Explanation: The LDAP binding method determines which user credentials are used to perform the initial bind to the external LDAP server.
Arguments
[arg1] The new setting
[arg2] The ID of user who changed the setting
[arg3] IP address of user who changed the setting
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0633I The LDAP user search attribute name setting was changed to [arg1] by user ID [arg2] at IP address [arg3].

li.p:
Explanation: The user search attribute name setting identifies the name of the LDAP attribute that is used on the LDAP server to look up users.
Arguments
[arg1] the new setting
[arg2] The ID of user who changed the setting
[arg3] IP address of user who changed the setting
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0634I The LDAP group search attribute name setting was changed to [arg1] by user ID [arg2] at IP address [arg3].

li.p:
Explanation: The group search attribute name setting identifies the name of the LDAP attribute that is used on the LDAP server to look up groups to which users belong.
Arguments
[arg1] the new setting
[arg2] The ID of user who changed the setting
[arg3] IP address of user who changed the setting
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0635I The LDAP setting to use servers as Global Catalogs was changed to [arg1] by user ID [arg2] at IP address [arg3].

li.p:
Explanation: This setting specifies whether configured LDAP servers should be used as Global Catalogs.
Arguments
[arg1] the new setting
[arg2] The ID of user who changed the setting
[arg3] IP address of user who changed the setting
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0640J DNS resolution of LDAP server addresses could not be completed successfully.

li.p:
Explanation: A search of {0} returned no records.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specfying a domain name that contains one or more LDAP service records.

p.b: FQXHMSE0641J The requested user authentication method could not be set successfully.

li.p:
Explanation: A test search returned {0} user and {1} role group entries. Setting the user authentication method to LDAP might render your management server inaccessible.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Create missing user or role group entries, and attempt the operation again.

p.b: FQXHMSE0642I The requested user authentication method was set successfully.

li.p:
Explanation: A test for connectivity and usability of the specified LDAP configuration indicates that LDAP authentication is likely to be successful.
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0643J The root distinguished name could not be determined.

li.p:
Explanation: No root distinguished name was specified, and the server did not return enough information to accurately determine the correct root distinguished name.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specfying a valid root distinguished name.

p.b: FQXHMSE0650J The request to change LDAP client settings could not be completed successfully.

li.p:
Explanation: A change might disrupt communication with managed systems.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Unmanage all managed systems, and attempt the operation again.

p.b: FQXHMSE0651I The domain name service returned the following response to a {0} service request.

li.p:
Explanation: {1}:{2}
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0652G The requested user authentication method was set successfully, but some warnings were noted.

li.p:
Explanation: A test for connectivity and usability of the specified LDAP configuration indicates that LDAP authentication is likely to be successful, but some warnings were noted. A complete list of messages has been provided.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Examine the complete list of messages, and correct the warnings as needed.

p.b: FQXHMSE0653J The root distinguished name is not valid.

li.p:
Explanation: The root distinguished name is not formatted correctly.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying a valid distinguished name according to RFC4514.

p.b: FQXHMSE0654G A search for user entries on the server could not be completed successfully.

li.p:
Explanation: The server returned {0} user entries. More entries might be available on the server; however, they could not be located using the specified root distinguished name.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Specify a blank root distinguished name to allow the management server to discover the correct value. This might not be supported by all LDAP servers.
Specify a different root distinguished name to allow the management server to discover more users.

p.b: FQXHMSE0655G A search for role group entries on the server could not be completed successfully.

li.p:
Explanation: The server returned {0} role group entries. More entries might be available on the server; however, they could not be located using the specified root distinguished name.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
If the required role groups exist on another server, such as a global catalog, no action is required.
Specify a blank root distinguished name to allow the management server to discover the correct value. This might not be supported by all LDAP servers.
Specify a different root distinguished name to allow the management server to discover more role groups.

p.b: FQXHMSE0656J No recovery user was found

li.p:
Explanation: When authentication is configured for external LDAP servers, one or more local users on the management server must be members of a group with the LXC-RECOVERY role so that the management server can be recovered if the LDAP servers become unavailable.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Add a user with login privileges on the management server to a role group that has the LXC-RECOVERY role.

p.b: FQXHMSE0699K All LDAP servers are unreachable.

li.p:
Explanation: Communication with all of the configured LDAP servers was not successful. This may interrupt communication between the management server and all managed servers. This problem may be due to a temporary server or network outage.
Arguments
Severity Error
Serviceable Yes
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Make sure that at least one LDAP server is running.
Make sure that there is network connectivity from the management server to at least one LDAP server.
If the management server is configured to use transport layer security, make sure that at least one LDAP server is providing the correct trusted certificate.
Make sure an entry with the client distinguished name and password configured on the management server exists in the LDAP directory.
If the problem persists:
Unmanage all managed servers.
Connect to each previously managed server and perform the documented recovery operation to return it to local user authentication.
Reconfigure the management server with the correct LDAP client settings, or Restore the LDAP client settings to their default values.
Remanage all previously managed servers.

p.b: FQXHMSE0735J The role deletion request was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The request to delete a role could not be completed because the request is not formatted correctly.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying a valid format.

p.b: FQXHMSE0736J The role deletion request was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The request to delete a role could not be completed because the specified role does not exist.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Verify that the role exists before deleting it.

p.b: FQXHMSE0737J The request to add a role was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The request to add a role could not be completed for an unknown reason.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying valid parameters. If the problem persists, contact Support.

p.b: FQXHMSE0740J The role group deletion request was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The request to delete a role group could not be completed because it has at least one user member.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Remove all users that are members of the specified role group. Then, attempt to delete the group again.

p.b: FQXHMSE0741J The role deletion request was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The request to delete a role could not be completed because the specified role name is reserved.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Do not attempt to delete a role that is reserved.

p.b: FQXHMSE0742J The request to modify a role group was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The request to modify a role group could not be completed because a specified user name is not valid or unknown.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Ensure that the specified users to associate with the role group are valid, known, and not reserved, and attempt the operation again.

p.b: FQXHMSE0750I The resource access control has been [arg1] by user ID [arg2] at the following IP address [arg3].

li.p:
Explanation: The specified user has changed the resource access control setting.
Arguments

[arg2] User ID of user who changed the resource access control.
[arg3] IP address of user who changed the resource access control.
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0751I Access to resource [arg1] was granted by user ID [arg2] at IP address [arg3] for the following role groups: [arg4].

li.p:
Explanation: The specified user has granted access to the specified resource for the specified role groups.
Arguments
[arg1] ID or Name of the resource
[arg2] User ID of user who granted the access
[arg3] IP address of user who granted the access
[arg4] Role groups who were granted the access to the resource
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0751J The request to {0} the resource access control was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The operation to change the resource access control could not be completed.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again. If the problem persists, collect service data and contact Support.

p.b: FQXHMSE0752I Access to resource [arg1] was modified by user ID [arg2] at IP address [arg3].

li.p:
Explanation: The specified user has modified access to the specified resource.
Arguments
[arg1] ID or Name of the resource
[arg2] User ID of user who modified the access details
[arg3] IP address of user who modified the access details
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0752J The request could not be completed successfully.

li.p:
Explanation: Resource management is not permitted when the user authentication method is LDAP.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Change the user authentication method to local, and attempt the operation again.

p.b: FQXHMSE0753I Access to resource [arg1] was removed by user ID [arg2] at IP address [arg3].

li.p:
Explanation: The specified user has removed access to the specified resource.
Arguments
[arg1] ID or Name of the resource
[arg2] User ID of user who removed the access
[arg3] IP address of user who removed the access
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0753J The request to set up a new resource access was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The request to set up a new resource access could not be completed because a parameter was not valid.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying valid parameters.

p.b: FQXHMSE0754J The request to setup a new resource access was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The request to to setup a new resource access could not be completed due to invalid settings.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying valid parameters .

li.p:
Explanation: The request to setup a new resource access could not be completed because the resource is not currently managed.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Ensure the resource is managed, and attempt the operation again.

p.b: FQXHMSE0756J The request to setup a new resource access was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The request to setup a new resource access could not be completed because the access for this resource already exists.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying another resource.

p.b: FQXHMSE0757J The request to setup a new resource access was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The request to setup a new resource access could not be completed for an unknown reason.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying valid parameters. If the problem persists, contact Support.

p.b: FQXHMSE0758J The request to modify the resource access was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The request to modify the resource access could not be completed because a parameter was not valid.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying valid parameters.

li.p:
Explanation: The request to modify the resource access could not be completed because the resource is not currently managed.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Ensure that the resource is managed, and attempt the operation again.

li.p:
Explanation: The request to modify the resource access could not be completed because the access for this resource does not exist.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying another resource.

li.p:
Explanation: The request to modify the resource access could not be completed because a parameter was not valid.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying valid parameters on the request.

p.b: FQXHMSE0762J The requested resource access does not exist.

li.p:
Explanation: The request could not be completed because the resource access does not exist.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying a different resource.

li.p:
Explanation: The request to modify the resource access could not be completed for an unknown reason.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying valid parameters on the request. If the problem persists, contact Support.

p.b: FQXHMSE0764J The request to delete the resource access was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The request to delete the resource access could not be completed because a parameter was not valid.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying valid parameters on the request.

p.b: FQXHMSE0765J The requested resource access does not exist.

li.p:
Explanation: The request could not be completed because the requested resource access does not exist.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying a different resource access.

p.b: FQXHMSE0766J The request to delete the resource access was was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The request to delete the resource access could not be completed because the resource is not currently managed.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Ensure that the resource is managed, and attempt the operation again.

p.b: FQXHMSE0767J The request to delete the resource access was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The request to delete the resource access could not be completed for an unknown reason.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying all required fields. If the problem persists, contact Support.

p.b: FQXHMSE0768J The request to delete resource access {0} was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The request to delete resource access {0} could not be completed because the resource identifier is reserved.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying a different resource identifier.

p.b: FQXHMSE0769J The request to add resource access {0} was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The request to add resource access {0} could not be completed because the resource identifier is reserved.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying a different resource identifier.

p.b: FQXHMSE0770J The authorization request could not be created due to invalid request data.

li.p:
Explanation: A resource ID in the request is not a valid UUID string.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Ensure that the UUID portion of any resource ID strings in the request are 32 hexadecimal digits in length, and attempt the operation again.

p.b: FQXHMSE0771J The authorization request could not be created due to missing request data.

li.p:
Explanation: Either the authorization URI or the method type was not specified in the request. When checking the authorization of a particular action on the server, both the URI and the method type of the REST function must be specified.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying both the authorization URI and method type.

p.b: FQXHMSE0772J The authorization request could not be created due to conflicting resources in the request data.

li.p:
Explanation: If a resource is specified in the request URI path, then resources may not be specified in the request body; likewise, if resources are specified in the request body, then a resource may not be specified in the request URI path.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying only a single resource in the request URI path or a list of resources.

p.b: FQXHMSE0773J The authorization request could not be created due to missing request data.

li.p:
Explanation: Either an authorization action or one or more resource IDs must be specified in the request in order to determine authorization status.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying either an authorization action consisting of a URI and a method type or at least one resource ID.

p.b: FQXHMSE0774J The authorization request could not be created because group membership could not be determined for the user.

li.p:
Explanation: The role group membership for the user associated with this request could not be determined due to an internal error.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Ensure that the user is authenticated for this request, and attempt the operation again. If the problem persists, contact Support.

p.b: FQXHMSE0775J The request to create the resource access was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The request to create the resource access could not be completed because some required fields were invalid or missing from the request.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying all required request parameters.

p.b: FQXHMSE0776J The request to modify the resource access was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The request to modify the resource access could not be completed because the resource identifier in the path did not match the resource identifier in the request body; this field may not be modified.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, making sure all specified resource identifiers are identical.

p.b: FQXHMSE0777J The request to modify resource access {0} was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The request to modify resource access {0} could not be completed because the resource identifier is reserved; neither the name nor the type may be modified for this resource access.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying a different resource identifier.

p.b: FQXHMSE0778J The requested resource access control operation was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The request could not be completed because a parameter was not valid.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying all required fields and path parameters. If the problem persists, contact Support.

p.b: FQXHMSE0779J The resource access control settings could not be retrieved.

li.p:
Explanation: A required artifact may be missing in the repository or an error may have occurred while attempting to retrieve the data.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Restart the management server and attempt the operation again. If the problem persists, contact Support.

p.b: FQXHMSE0780J The request to update the resource access control settings could not be completed.

li.p:
Explanation: An internal error occurred while updating the repository.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again. If the problem persists, contact Support.

p.b: FQXHMSE0781J The request to update the resource access control settings could not be completed.

li.p:
Explanation: One or more of the specified role groups or a required artifact could not be found in the repository.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Ensure that all specified role groups exist on the system and attempt the operation again. If the problem persists, contact Support.

p.b: FQXHMSE0796I Resource Access Control was disabled by user [arg1] at IP address [arg2].

li.p:
Explanation: The Resource Access Control function was disabled. User authorization for managed systems will no longer be enforced based on configured Resource Access Control settings.
Arguments
[arg1] The ID of the user who changed the setting
[arg2] The IP address of the user who changed the setting
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0797I Resource Access Control was enabled by user [arg1] at IP address [arg2].

li.p:
Explanation: The Resource Access Control function was enabled. User authorization for managed systems will be enforced based on configured Resource Access Control settings.
Arguments
[arg1] The ID of the user who changed the setting
[arg2] The IP address of the user who changed the setting
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0798I The following role groups were added to the list of default Resource Access Control role groups by user [arg1] at IP address [arg2]: [arg3].

li.p:
Explanation: One or more role groups were added to the list of default Resource Access Control role groups. Default Resource Access Control role groups are automatically associated with new managed systems.
Arguments
[arg1] The ID of the user who added the default role groups
[arg2] The IP address of the user who added the default role groups
[arg3] A list containing the names of the role groups that were added to the list of default Resource Access Control role groups
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0799I The following role groups were removed from the list of default Resource Access Control role groups by user [arg1] at IP address [arg2]: [arg3].

li.p:
Explanation: One or more role groups were removed from the list of default Resource Access Control role groups. Default Resource Access Control role groups are automatically associated with new managed systems.
Arguments
[arg1] The ID of the user who removed the default role groups
[arg2] The IP address of the user who removed the default role groups
[arg3] A list containing the names of the role groups that were removed from the list of default Resource Access Control role groups
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0800I Service provider metadata has been regenerated by [arg1].

li.p:
Explanation: The specified user has regenerated the service provider metadata
Arguments
[arg1] The user who regenerated the metadata
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0801I Identity provider metadata has been regenerated by [arg1].

li.p:
Explanation: The specified user has regenerated the identity provider metadata
Arguments
[arg1] The user who regenerated the metadata
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0802I SAML single sign on has been disabled by [arg1].

li.p:
Explanation: The specified user has disabled SAML single sign on
Arguments
[arg1] The user who disabled SAML single sign on
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0803I SAML single sign on has been enabled by [arg1].

li.p:
Explanation: The specified user has enabled SAML single sign on
Arguments
[arg1] The user who enabled SAML single sign on
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0810J The external login request was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The management server encountered an unexpected error.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Refer to identity provider logs to determine the error. If the problem persists, contact Support.

p.b: FQXHMSE0811J The external login request was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The identity provider could not provide a list of role group memberships.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Configure the identity provider to provide a list of role group memberships, and attempt the operation again.

p.b: FQXHMSE0812J The external logon request was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The specified user is not a member of any locally configured role groups.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Add the specified user to at least one locally configured role group, and attempt the operation again.

p.b: FQXHMSE0813J The external login request was not successful because the identity provider is not configured.

li.p:
Explanation: The identity provider is not configured. Import valid identity provider metadata.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Refer to identity provider manual to obtain the metadata and import into server. Use recovery URL to log in and import metadata.
If the metadata is signed, import the identity provider's signing certificate into the management server, and attempt the operation again.
If the metadata is not signed, import the identity provider's metadata in the correct XML format, and attempt the operation again.

p.b: FQXHMSE0814J The external login request was not successful because the response issue time is not valid.

li.p:
Explanation: The response issue time was either too old or too new. The management server and identity provider clocks must be synchronized.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Ensure that the identity provider and management server are both synchronized by a common NTP server

p.b: FQXHMSE0815J Regeneration of the service provider metadata was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: If the management server was restarted, or its IP address has changed, the server certificate might need to be regenerated. This might happen automatically, if the server certificate has not been replaced.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Regenerate the server certificate, and attempt the operation again.

p.b: FQXHMSE0816J The identity provider metadata could not be validated.

li.p:
Explanation: Either the identity provider's signature could not be validated or the metadata was not formatted correctly.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response =
If the metadata is signed, import the identity provider's signing certificate into the management server, and attempt the operation again.
If the metadata is not signed, import the identity provider's metadata in the correct XML format, and attempt the operation again.

p.b: FQXHMSE0817J The request completed successfully.

li.p:
Explanation: The request completed successfully.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response The settings have been saved. Log out and log back in to the management server to begin using the new configuration.

p.b: FQXHMSE0818J The core service could not be restarted.

li.p:
Explanation: The command to restart the core service failed.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Restart the management server from the "Shut Down Management Server" function in the Administration menu.

p.b: FQXHMSE0819J Retrieving certificate from endpoint {0} has failed

li.p:
Explanation: Retrieving certificate from endpoint {0} has failed: {1}
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again. If the problem persists, collect service data and contact Support.

p.b: FQXHMSE0900J The requested stored credentials operation was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The request could not be completed because a parameter was not valid.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying all required fields and path parameters. If the problem persists, contact Support.

p.b: FQXHMSE0901J The requested stored credentials do not exist.

li.p:
Explanation: The request could not be completed because the stored credentials for the specified ID does not exist.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying a different stored credentials ID.

p.b: FQXHMSE0902J The stored credentials user name is not valid.

li.p:
Explanation: The requested stored credentials operation could not be completed because the user name was empty or it was not specified in the request.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying a valid user name.

p.b: FQXHMSE0903J The stored credentials password is not valid.

li.p:
Explanation: The requested stored credentials operation could not be completed because the password was empty or it was not specified in the request.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying a valid password.

p.b: FQXHMSE0904J The credentials could not be created and stored.

li.p:
Explanation: An internal server error occurred when attempting to save the specified credentials in the LXCA data store.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Retry the operation. If the failure persists, collect service data and report the problem to customer support.

p.b: FQXHMSE0905J The credentials could not be updated.

li.p:
Explanation: An internal server error occurred when attempting to save the modified credentials in the LXCA data store.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Retry the operation. If the failure persists, collect service data and report the problem to customer support.

p.b: FQXHMSE0906J The credentials were not removed because they are currently in use.

li.p:
Explanation: One or more managed endpoints are currently associated with these stored credentials. The credentials cannot be removed from the LXCA data store until all managed endpoint associations are removed.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Choose different stored credentials for each of the managed endpoints that are currently using these credentials.

p.b: FQXHMSE0907J The credentials could not be removed.

li.p:
Explanation: An internal server error occurred when attempting to remove the credentials from the LXCA data store.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Retry the operation. If the failure persists, collect service data and report the problem to customer support.

p.b: FQXHMSE0908J The stored credentials user name is not valid.

li.p:
Explanation: The requested stored credentials operation could not be completed because the specified user name does not meet maximum length requirements. The user name must be no longer than {0} characters.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying a valid user name.

p.b: FQXHMSE0909J The stored credentials description is not valid.

li.p:
Explanation: The requested stored credentials operation could not be completed because the specified description does not meet maximum length requirements. The description must be no longer than {0} characters.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying a valid description.

p.b: FQXHMSE0910I Stored credentials with ID [arg1] and the following user name and description were added by user [arg2] at IP address [arg3]: [arg4] - [arg5].

li.p:
Explanation: A new set of stored credentials were added to the system. Stored credentials consist of a user name and password. They can be used to perform operations on managed systems.
Arguments
[arg1] The unique ID of the new stored credentials
[arg2] The ID of user who changed the setting
[arg3] IP address of user who changed the setting
[arg4] The user name of the new stored credentials
[arg5] The description of the new stored credentials
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0911I Stored credentials with ID [arg1] and the following user name and description were removed by user [arg2] at IP address [arg3]: [arg4] - [arg5].

li.p:
Explanation: A set of stored credentials were removed from the system. Stored credentials consist of a user name and password. They can be used to perform operations on managed systems.
Arguments
[arg1] The unique ID of the stored credentials that were removed
[arg2] The ID of user who changed the setting
[arg3] IP address of user who changed the setting
[arg4] The user name of the stored credentials that were removed
[arg5] The description of the stored credentials that were removed
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0912I The user name of the stored credentials with ID [arg1] was changed to the following by user [arg2] at IP address [arg3]: [arg4] - [arg5].

li.p:
Explanation: The user name of an existing set of stored credentials was changed on the system. Stored credentials consist of a user name and password. They can be used to perform operations on managed systems.
Arguments
[arg1] The unique ID of the stored credentials that changed
[arg2] The ID of user who changed the setting
[arg3] IP address of user who changed the setting
[arg4] The new user name of the stored credentials that was set by the user
[arg5] The current description of the stored credentials
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0913I The description of the stored credentials with ID [arg1] was changed to the following by user [arg2] at IP address [arg3]: [arg4] - [arg5].

li.p:
Explanation: The description of an existing set of stored credentials was changed on the system. Stored credentials consist of a user name and password. They can be used to perform operations on managed systems.
Arguments
[arg1] The unique ID of the stored credentials that changed
[arg2] The ID of user who changed the setting
[arg3] IP address of user who changed the setting
[arg4] The current user name of the stored credentials
[arg5] The description of the stored credentials that was set by the user
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0914I The password of the stored credentials with ID [arg1] and the following user name and description was changed by user [arg2] at IP address [arg3]: [arg4] - [arg5].

li.p:
Explanation: The password of an existing set of stored credentials was changed on the system. Stored credentials consist of a user name and password. They can be used to perform operations on managed systems.
Arguments
[arg1] The unique ID of the stored credentials that changed
[arg2] The ID of user who changed the setting
[arg3] IP address of user who changed the setting
[arg4] The user name of the stored credentials
[arg5] The description of the stored credentials
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0915I Head of Stack feature not supported for firmware [arg1].

li.p:
Explanation: Head of Stack feature is not supported in this firmware.
Arguments
[arg1] firmware of chassis
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMSE0915J The specified user name and password combination already exists.

li.p:
Explanation: The stored credentials could not be created or updated because the specified user name and password combination already exists in a separate set of stored credentials. User name and password combinations must be unique in the LXCA data store.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt the operation again, specifying a different user name or password.

li.p:
Explanation: Head of Stack feature supported for this firmware.

Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response
Information only; no action is required.

Explanation: A previous request to generate a Service Data file was still in process. Therefore a new request could not be started.
Arguments
[arg1] The user that made the request.
[arg2] IP address of the user.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response

p.b: FQXHMSS1024J The request by user [arg1] at IP address [arg2] to upload a file was not successful, because the file name was not valid.

li.p:
Explanation: There are only specific file names that are valid to upload. This function should only be performed at the direction of the Service team, using files provided by them.
Arguments
[arg1] The user that made the request.
[arg2] IP address of the user.
Severity Warning
Serviceable no
Automatically notify support no
User Response
Check to make sure the file name matches what was provided by the Service team, then try again.

p.b: FQXHMSS1025J The request by user [arg1] at IP address [arg2] to upload a file was not successful, because the file could not be written to disk.

li.p:
Explanation: The file could not be written to disk due to a permissions, connectivity or file system issue.
Arguments
[arg1] The user that made the request.
[arg2] IP address of the user.
Severity Warning
Serviceable no
Automatically notify support no
User Response
Check to make sure the user was running as a supervisor level, and that there are no connectivity issues. Then retry the operation.

p.b: FQXHMSS1026J The request by user [arg1] at IP address [arg2] to upload a file was not successful, because a temp file could not deleted.

li.p:
Explanation: A new file cannot be uploaded if the temp version of it cannot be deleted.
Arguments
[arg1] The user that made the request.
[arg2] IP address of the user.
Severity Warning
Serviceable no
Automatically notify support no
User Response
Check to make sure the user was running as a supervisor level, and that there are no connectivity issues. Then retry the operation.

p.b: FQXHMSS1027J The request by user [arg1] at IP address [arg2] to upload a file was not successful, because the file format was not valid.

li.p:

Arguments
[arg1] The user that made the request.
[arg2] IP address of the user.
Severity Warning
Serviceable no
Automatically notify support no
User Response
Ensure that the file that was received from the Service team has not been modified. Retry the upload of the file received from the Service team.

Automatically notify support No

p.b: FQXHMST0007G Endpoint {0} could not be accessed because credentials were refused.

li.p:
Explanation: The operation cannot be performed because of a problem with the credentials.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt to manage the endpoint again. Then attempt to perform the operation again.

p.b: FQXHMST0008G Endpoint {0} could not be accessed.

li.p:
Explanation: The operation cannot be performed because of a problem with the endpoint connectivity.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Check to ensure there are no connectivity issues to the endpoint and retry the operation. If the problem persists, contact Support.

p.b: FQXHMST0009G User {0} cannot access the endpoint {1}.

li.p:
Explanation: The operation performed to the server failed due to an internal communication infrastructure failure.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Restart the management server and retry the operation. If the problem persists, contact Support.

p.b: FQXHMST0010G The SSL/TLS certificate provided by the {0} endpoint is not valid.

li.p:
Explanation: The operation performed to the server failed due to an SSL certificate error.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response The SSL/TLS certificate provided by the endpoint is not valid.
Restarting the system's Management on Storage Controllers the certificate is regenerated.

p.b: FQXHMST0015G The controller {0} is not operational.

li.p:
Explanation: The operation cannot be performed because of a problem with the endpoint operability.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Restart the Storage Controller in this controller module, unless it is performing an operation where it is normal for it to be shut down, such as firmware update.

p.b: FQXHMTS0001G A trap alert destination subscription failure occurred when user {0} managed server {1}

li.p:
Explanation: This will cause the management server to not receive events from managed server.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Log into the managed server's user interface for this server, and add the management server IP address into the Alert Policy to receive notifications.

p.b: FQXHMTS0002G A trap alert destination unsubscription failure occurred when user {0} unmanaged server {1}

li.p:
Explanation: This will cause the management server to continue to receive events on this server.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Log into the managed server's user interface for this server, and remove the Alert Policy created.

p.b: FQXHMTS0003G Inventory data could not be retrieved from the endpoint {0}. BIOS: {1}, BMC: {2}

li.p:
Explanation: The attempt to retrieve the most updated inventory data has failed.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Check to ensure there are no connectivity issues to the endpoint.

p.b: FQXHMTS0004G Credentials could not be updated from endpoint {0}

li.p:
Explanation: Security policies could not be updated when accessing the endpoint.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Check to ensure there are no connectivity issues to the endpoint and retry the operation. If the problem persists, contact Support.

p.b: FQXHMTS0005G User {0} cannot removed the credentials from endpoint {1}

li.p:
Explanation: Security policies could not be removed from the endpoint.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Check to ensure there are no connectivity issues to the endpoint and retry the operation. If the problem persists, contact Support.

p.b: FQXHMTS0006G User {0} cannot remove endpoint {1}.

li.p:
Explanation: An error occurred when attempting to remove the endpoint.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Check to ensure there are no connectivity issues to the endpoint and retry the operation. If the problem persists, contact Support.

p.b: FQXHMTS0007G There is no IPMI user slot available in the endpoint when user {0} was managing the server {1}

li.p:
Explanation: There is no user slot availabe to create a user in the end point.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Log into the managed server and remove any users that are no longer used.

p.b: FQXHMTS0008G The NTP server could not be set on the endpoint when user {0} was managing the server {1}.

li.p:
Explanation: This will likely render the endpoint time unsynchronized to the management server.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Log into the managed server and set the NTP server in the Date/Time options.

p.b: FQXHMTS0009G Endpoint {0} could not be accessed because credentials were refused.

li.p:
Explanation: The operation cannot be performed because of a problem with the credentials.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Attempt to manage the endpoint again. Then attempt to perform the operation again.

p.b: FQXHMTS0010G Endpoint {0} could not be accessed.

li.p:
Explanation: The operation cannot be performed because of a problem with the endpoint connectivity.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Check to ensure there are no connectivity issues to the endpoint and retry the operation. If the problem persists, contact Support.

p.b: FQXHMTS0011G User {0} cannot access the endpoint {1}.

Explanation: The operation performed to the server failed due to an internal communication infrastructure failure.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Restart the management server and retry the operation. If the problem persists, contact Support.

p.b: FQXHMUP1000I The command completed successfully.

li.p:
Explanation: The command completed successfully.
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMUP1103L The inventory update request was not successful.

li.p:
Explanation: The inventory request requires a valid target for updates. The request could not be completed because the target was missing.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Retry the request and provide a valid target for updates {chassis, cmms, nodes, switches}.

p.b: FQXHMUP2000I The command completed successfully.

li.p:
Explanation: The command completed successfully.
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMUP2001G No managed data was found.

Explanation: A chassis or rack server must be managed before firmware updates can be applied to devices.

Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Use the Hardware page to manage at least one chassis or rack server. Then, attempt to update firmware again.

p.b: FQXHMUP2002L Could not retrieve inventory.

li.p:
Explanation: Inventory could not be retrieved because the required option is missing.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Retry the request, specifying a valid option {full, chassis, nodes, switches}.

Explanation: The inventory retrieval could not complete because the provided option {0} is not valid.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Retry the request, specifying a valid option {full, chassis, cmms, nodes, switches, racks, all}.

p.b: FQXHMUP2004J The managed chassis list does not contain any {0}.

li.p:
Explanation: The management server did not find any managed {0}. Updates can only be performed on managed devices.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Use the Chassis page to manage at least one chassis. Then, attempt to update firmware again.

p.b: FQXHMUP2005J Inventory collection did not find any {0} with an UUID of {1}.

li.p:
Explanation: No managed {0} were found with an UUID of {1}.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Use the Chassis page to manage the chassis that contains the device with the UUID of {0}.

p.b: FQXHMUP2006N The inventory retrieval request could not complete.

li.p:
Explanation: The inventory retrieval could not complete because the provided device type {0} was not valid.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Retry the request, specifying a valid device type {full, chassis, cmms, nodes, switches}.

p.b: FQXHMUP2007F Inventory retrieval was not complete.

Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Retry the request.

li.p:
Explanation: An internal error has occurred. It cannot continue to run normally.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Relaunch the management server. If the error persists, restart your system and try again.

p.b: FQXHMUP2101L Could not retrieve the token for the provided device.

li.p:
Explanation: The specified UUID of the device was null or blank.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Retry the request, specifying the valid UUID of the target device.

p.b: FQXHMUP2102J Could not retrieve the token for the provided device {0}.

li.p:
Explanation: The request for the remote token failed with return code {0}.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Verify that the node with the specified UUID has remote capability.

p.b: FQXHMUP2103L The inventory update request could not complete.

li.p:
Explanation: The inventory request could not complete because a required option was missing.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No

li.p:
Explanation: The request could not complete.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Retry the request.

p.b: FQXHMUP2200I This is a supported device.

li.p:
Explanation: This is a supported device.
Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMUP2201G Ethernet over USB is not enabled for device {0}.

li.p:
Explanation: Firmware updates are not supported on a device when Ethernet over USB is not enabled on that device.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Access the management controller interface for the device, and verify that the option is enabled. See your management controller documentation for instructions.

p.b: FQXHMUP2202G Firmware updates to the standby CMM are not supported on device {0}.

li.p:
Explanation: Firmware updates cannot be applied directly to the standby CMM because it is automatically updated by the primary CMM.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response When applying firmware updates to a CMM, make sure that the primary CMM is selected.

p.b: FQXHMUP2203G Stacked mode is enabled on Flex System switch {0}.

li.p:
Explanation: Firmware updates are not supported on a Flex System switch when stacking mode is enabled.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Disable the stacking mode on the Flex System switch.

p.b: FQXHMUP2204G Protected mode is enabled on Flex System switch {0}.

li.p:
Explanation: Firmware updates are not supported on a Flex System switch when protected mode is enabled.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Disable protected mode on the Flex System switch.

p.b: FQXHMUP2205G Device {0} is in an unsupported complex.

li.p:
Explanation: Firmware updates are not supported on complexes if there is more than one partition or if there are unassigned nodes.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Create a single partition and place all possible devices in the complex into that partition.

p.b: FQXHMUP2206G Component {0} is in an unsupported option.

li.p:
Explanation: Firmware updates are not supported on this option; therefore the firmware will not be updated.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Use some other method to update the firmware for this component.

p.b: FQXHMUP2207G Device {0} is an unsupported device with a machine type of {1}.

li.p:
Explanation: Firmware updates are not supported on that device.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Use some other method to update the firmware for this device.

p.b: FQXHMUP2208G Down-level firmware was found on option {0}.

li.p:
Explanation: The firmware is down-level on this option where it does not provide vital data in order to associate a suitable firmware package.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response The Apply / Activate page provides generated options for each device; choose a generated option which closely matches the option with down-level firmware.

p.b: FQXHMUP2209G This device is not accessible.

li.p:
Explanation: Firmware updates cannot be applied to this device because it is not accessible.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Verify that the device is accessible on the network using the provided credentials to this application.

p.b: FQXHMUP2210G Device {0} is an unsupported node in the complex.

li.p:
Explanation: Firmware updates cannot be applied to this complex due to an unsupported node in the complex.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Find the offending node in the complex and take action on the unsupported reason..

p.b: FQXHMUP2211G Firmware updates to the active banks of switch modules are not supported on device {0}.

li.p:
Explanation: Firmware updates cannot be applied directly to the active banks of switch modules.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response When applying firmware updates to a switch module, the inactive bank is updated and becomes the active bank during activation.

p.b: FQXHMUP2212G Inventory collection is not complete.

li.p:
Explanation: Firmware updates cannot be applied to this device because inventory collection is not complete.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Inventory collection might take several minutes to complete. Try updating this device again later.

p.b: FQXHMUP2213G Could not retrieve the IP address for the provided device.

li.p:
Explanation: The IP address of the device was null or blank.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Verify that the device is accessible on the network.

p.b: FQXHMUP2214G Inventory collection will complete after the device powers on.

li.p:
Explanation: Complete inventory collection requires the device to power on to collect component data.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Power on the device.

p.b: FQXHMUP2215L The security certificate that is used to establish a secure connection to a managed device has become untrusted.

li.p:
Explanation: The security certificate is untrusted and might be out of sync with the expected certificate.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response From the Lenovo XClarity Administrator menu bar, click Hardware, and select your device from the list. Click All Actions > Resolve Untrusted Certificates > Install Certificates.

p.b: FQXHMUP2216G OS device-driver updates are not supported for this device.

li.p:
Explanation: OS device-driver updates are not supported for this device.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response

p.b: FQXHMUP2217G Device-driver updates are not supported for this operating system.

Explanation: Device-driver updates are not supported for this operating system.

Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response

p.b: FQXHMUP2500I Repository operation completed successfully.

Explanation: Repository operation completed successfully.

Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMUP2501G The repository operation could not complete because an update is in use.

Explanation: An update is assigned to a policy or it is in the process of being applied. The operation cannot be completed until the update is available.

Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Remove the update from all policies or wait until all updates have been applied. Then, retry the operation.

Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No

Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Check all parameters. Then, retry the operation.

Explanation: The repository operation failed because there was a communication problem with the fix service provider.

Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Check the network connection. Retry the operation.

li.p:
Explanation: The delete operation could not complete because one or more updates depend on this update.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Delete all dependent updates first. Then, retry the operation.

Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No

Explanation: The repository operation was canceled successfully.

Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No

Severity Informational
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Information only; no action is required.

p.b: FQXHMUP2510L The update package cannot be added to the repository because the repository is full.

li.p:
Explanation: There is not enough disk space in the repository to add the update package.
Severity Error
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No

Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No

p.b: FQXHMUP2512F The import process is complete. Some files were discarded.

Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No

li.p:
Explanation: The following files are invalid signed packages and were discarded: {0}.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No

li.p:
Explanation: The following files are not recognized as update packages and were discarded: {0}.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No

Explanation: The following files are for update types that are not supported and were discarded: {0}.

Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No

li.p:
Explanation: The following files are for operating systems that are not supported and were discarded: {0}.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No

p.b: FQXHMUP2517F The import process is complete. Some files were discarded.

li.p:
Explanation: The following files are for machine type that are not supported and were discarded: {0}.
Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
User Response Ensure that the files being imported are for supported machine types, then attempt to import the files again.

p.b: FQXHMUP2518F The import process is complete. Some files were discarded.

Severity Warning
Serviceable No
Automatically notify support No
